title: Spring forces - 2 forces and 2 horizontal springs

content.question: Two springs are each fixed in place at one end and lie on a horizontal surface, with negligible friction between the surface and either spring. One of the springs has spring constant <math alttext="k sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>k</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>. When a force <math alttext="F sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> is exerted on the free end of the spring, the spring compresses a distance <math alttext="d sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>d</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>. If the second spring has spring constant <math alttext="3 times k sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><msub><mi>k</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and a force <math alttext="2 times F sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> is exerted on its free end, how far does the second spring compress?

choices.label: <math alttext="one sixth times d sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>6</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>d</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="two thirds times d sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>2</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>d</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="three halves times d sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>3</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>d</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="6 times d sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>6</mn><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>d</mi></mstyle><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="two thirds times d sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>2</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>d</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
